cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north through the Yucatan Channel, expected to accelerate northeast across the eastern Gulf, make landfall on the Florida Panhandle mid-week, then sweep NE across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic and move offshore south of New England by late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near/east of Apalachicola–Panama City, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for Pinar del Río & Isle of Youth (Cuba) and the coast of Mexico from Tulum to Cabo Catoche.  Hurricane and tropical-storm watches expected later for the northeastern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area above (tropical-storm warning in Cuba & Yucatán).  No U.S. Atlantic-coast warnings yet.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle → Georgia & Carolinas inland → Mid-Atlantic → offshore New England (including Cape Cod and Gulf of Maine waters).
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤10%) of sustained gale-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible Friday as the system passes SE of Cape Cod.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (<3 ft) possible along the Massachusetts coast late Friday with persistent SE winds, but significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday into early Saturday as the remnant low/front sweeps through.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions (8–12 ft offshore waves), elevated rip-current risk Friday–Saturday could disrupt pilotage and cargo operations.
